Method Detail

presentYesNoDialog

public static int presentYesNoDialog(java.lang.String app_abbr,
                                     java.lang.String dialog_title,
                                     java.lang.String yes_no_message,
                                     java.awt.Component parent_comp,
                                     javax.swing.ImageIcon icon)
Presents a yes-no dialog with a Yes, No, and Cancel button.

Parameters:
app_abbr - the String abbreviation of this application to use in constructing the title line of this dialog. If null, no abbreviation is used. If non-null, a title of the form '<abbr>: <dialog_title>' is used.
dialog_title - the title string to show within the title line of this dialog.
yes_no_message - the actual message to show in the dialog.
parent_comp - the Component to have as a parent of this dialog.
icon - the ImageIcon to present to the left of the yes_no_message. If null, a default ImageIcon is used.
Returns:
0 when we have an answer of yes, non-zero for no or cancel.

presentMessageDialog

public static void presentMessageDialog(java.lang.String app_abbr,
                                        java.lang.String dialog_title,
                                        java.lang.Object message,
                                        java.awt.Component parent_comp)
Presents a message dialog with an OK button.

Parameters:
app_abbr - the String abbreviation of this application to use in constructing the title line of this dialog. If null, no abbreviation is used. If non-null, a title of the form '<abbr>: <dialog_title>' is used.
dialog_title - the title string to show within the title line of this dialog.
message - the actual message to show in the dialog. This can be a String, Object or a nested array of Objects that include components to present.
parent_comp - the Component to have as a parent of this dialog.

ensureCorrectSuffix

public static java.lang.String ensureCorrectSuffix(java.lang.String file_path,
                                                   java.lang.String[] correct_suffixes,
                                                   java.lang.String suffix_to_add)
Ensure a given file path has a correct suffix.

Parameters:
file_path - the path to check for a legal suffix.
correct_suffixes - a String array of legal suffixes. If file_path doesn't have one of these suffixes, suffix_to_add is added to file_path (e.g, {"jpg", "jpeg"}).
suffix_to_add - the suffix to add when file_path has no suffix or an incorrect suffix (e.g., "jpg").
Returns:
file_path if it has a correct suffix, otherwise file_path with suffix_to_add appended to its end.

checkIfOverwriteOK

public static boolean checkIfOverwriteOK(java.lang.String component_abbr,
                                         java.lang.String file_path,
                                         java.awt.Component component)
Check if a given file path exists and if it can be overwritten. Present dialogs for user input as needed.

Parameters:
component_abbr - the abbreviation for this component (e.g., "ANV") used in presenting needed dialogs
file_path - the String file path to check
component - The Component in which to present needed dialogs.

                               java.awt.Component comp)
